diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@
 from .scatter_gather import scatter, gather
 from .distributed import DistributedDataParallel
 from .distributed_cpu import DistributedDataParallelCPU
+from .distributed_c10d import DistributedDataParallelC10d
 
 __all__ = ['replicate', 'scatter', 'parallel_apply', 'gather', 'data_parallel',
-           'DataParallel', 'DistributedDataParallel', 'DistributedDataParallelCPU']
+           'DataParallel', 'DistributedDataParallel', 'DistributedDataParallelCPU',
+           'DistributedDataParallelC10d']
body: No, this struct should not appear here. Ideally it would be private (prefixed with an underscore). We never want to have `DistributedDataParallelC10d` as part of our public API, we'll need to replace the regular `DistributedDataParallel` once c10d becomes our main distributed backend.
body_html: No, this struct should not appear here. Ideally it would be private (prefixed with an underscore). We never want to have DistributedDataParallelC10d as part of our public API, we'll need to replace the regular DistributedDataParallel once c10d becomes our main distributed backend.
body_text: No, this struct should not appear here. Ideally it would be private (prefixed with an underscore). We never want to have DistributedDataParallelC10d as part of our public API, we'll need to replace the regular DistributedDataParallel once c10d becomes our main distributed backend.
